website_summaries.verdict: In the weight, comfort, and design categories, the Mountain 600 EnduroWeave from Danner is simply spectacular. It is also a gear that greatly excels on the breathability front, making it a worthy ally for adventurers who prefer hiking in warm environments. Unfortunately, the greatness of this shoe stops at its footbed—its presence is nothing to write home about. Overall, to get the most out of the Danner Mountain 600 EnduroWeave, wearers have to first deal with its lackluster insole; whether by learning to love it or by just replacing it.
pros: Quite a number of reviewers, which include professional ones, found the Mountain 600 EnduroWeave fantastically breathable
Its amazing level of comfort stunned footgear critics
This airy Danner hiker impressed bloggers with its remarkable lightness
Many users only had applause for the boot’s jaw-dropping looks
Several wearers regarded the Mountain 600 EnduroWeave’s width as pretty accurate
Shoe pundits commended the footgear’s stellar flexibility
The footwear’s super-grippy outsole mesmerized a couple of owners
An expert experienced an astonishingly stable ride in this mid-top hiking shoe
cons: The gear’s humdrum insole was bashed by a consumer
A footwear tester by profession was disappointed with the boot’s stiffness at the outset

customer_reviews.title: Thought the quality would be a little better..
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these boots for about a month. They fit perfectly, grip well over loose terrain, super comfy, even over the course of a 9 day backpacking trip. They’re also super light, and good looking till you actually hike/ break em in. However I’ve probably not even put 100 miles on them and the “tough” fiber woven upper material has several snags in it, is fraying at the ankle area and the toe box/cap is coming unglued on both feet. I thought Danners would be a little higher quality but overall I still like them for my first pair of hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Great dressy-ish multi-purpose boot...
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a (non-Goretex) boot that was dressy enough to wear to the office or out to dinner and not scream "tactical!" but would still serve me well in an E&E or any other kind of SHTF situation. These boots fit the bill; stylish enough to wear on a date, but they are light, have great tread, good support and typical Danner quality. I bought the brown pair but will probably end up purchasing the black one at some point. I wish they came in grey, but c'est la vie.
customer_reviews.author: 916hammer

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quality boot that was not waterproof for desert hiking, and have worn these several times all day at work (always in motion), and they are very comfortable with minimal break in needed. I ordered my regular size (12) rather than a half size smaller as recommended, so I could wear cushioned socks when needed, and the fit seems fine. The true test on the trail is yet to come, but based on the usage already experienced, I do not expect issues. No heel lift, good instep and lacing, feels great and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Majak

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, value, comfort
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots. They look good and seem to be very sturdy and well made. After breaking them in on a few hikes, they have become comfortable. I expect to use them for years to come. They are a good value, compared to some brands I have bought at a similar price, which fall apart pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Foss

customer_reviews.title: Look like very good hot weather hikers
customer_reviews.text: Just received these boots and took a first hike today, so very early impressions. Appear to be very well made, especially in contrast to most hot weather hikers. The inner liner around the heel (achilles) looks to be a little stiff and lacking padding, but they were very comfortable on the hike; didn't notice any problems in that area. Very comfortable out of the box. Lightweight and at the same time stable and supportive. Only time will tell, but first impressions are that they breathe very well without allowing dust and dirt through the fabric. Looks like they will be excellent hot weather hikers for a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Danner Never Disappoints.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this boot struckly for casual use for my trip to Denver, CO. I need a boot versatile enough for inclement weather but also easy to rotate outfits with. I love the fit, extremely comfortable. I was able to wear them for hours without any issue. They kept my foot warm and dry during snow tubing. I also enjoyed the material they used and can never go wrong with Vibram sole. Highly recommend, this boot is versatile for a little of everything! This is my 2nd pair of Danner boots.
customer_reviews.author: M.Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Durability on these Shoes with Few Hiking Days!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible Durability on these shoes with few hiking days! The sole is beginning to peel back. And, the top material called "EnduroWeave" is anything but enduring! Wish I could return these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy them, you won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased this danner boot in both leather and black textile now and I cannot stress how great I believe these boots are. The vibram sole shines in this application I would recommend you try them (remember to wear appropriate socks)
customer_reviews.author: CDavies

customer_reviews.title: Decent boot, some flaws
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable good hot weather boot. My only complaint is durability. The rubber that wraps up the toes is already peeling off. The toe caps in general seem to be wearing out already.
customer_reviews.author: BeckCo

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: Run 1/2 large... measured against my running shoe insole. Boot insole 9 Runner 9.5 Both insoles were identical in length. I am extremely picky about my shoes. Had both 9-9.5 and ended up keeping the 9’s. Good luck to those with the same foot OCD.
customer_reviews.author: mike rauenzahn

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight super comfortable look good too. I’m on my feet at work a lot and do a lot of walking on all sorts of terrain and can’t say enough how comfortable these boots are. I liked them so much I bought them both colors.
customer_reviews.author: CanineCopper

customer_reviews.title: Not got shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable. The toe box would cave in with every step and rub on the top of my feet. Not impressed with the material either. They feel like they are super cheap quality.
customer_reviews.author: Trout89

customer_reviews.title: I needed to buy a comfortable and dependable pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: With fall, then winter approaching, I needed to buy a comfortable and dependable pair of boots, for wearing outdoors, so I bought these Danner hiking boots and tested them, using them at work. My first pair of Danners possesses the comfort of the best athletic shoes I've ever worn, yet they're hiking boots! I will most definitely, buy another pair of these Danners, for outside my job. In my opinion, the fit, comfort, style and price are all great!
customer_reviews.author: 2real

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the Total Archery Challenge in Utah. Wore them for the first time this morning before the event. Just put 7 miles of crazy terrain with over 1000 ft of elevation change. 7 hours of intense hiking and my feet are in perfect condition! Definitely recommend and totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: r. weigant

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Broke them in with a 8 mile hike with some verticals and downhill inclines which tested them. My foot stayed in place without any extreme lacing. they are the lightest boot to date. I have Merrill, timberland, and a couple other leather stiff boots. These Danner's were by far the best performing, lightest,comfortable and have exceptional grip across wet rocks, moss, loose rocks, loose dirt etc. Great pair of boots!
customer_reviews.author: JDavidson

customer_reviews.title: Try on a pair of Danner boots before ordering
customer_reviews.text: Nice boot but poor fit. I ordered 1/2 size smaller but should have ordered a full size smaller. I had to use extra inserts to keep the boots snug which makes a the laces tight.
customer_reviews.author: Krieger

customer_reviews.title: These are great hikers. Extremely light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are great hikers. Extremely light and comfortable. Only flaw is that they are not even remotely waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: scott gingrich

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: Great pair for three seasons worth hiking. No break in time. Taking this to colorado next week to hit the 14ers. Cant wait!
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious hiking
customer_reviews.text: More of a fashion boot then a hiking boot would send them back if I hadn’t worn them
customer_reviews.author: brent marshall

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Look good, EXCELLENT VaLue Great on the trail!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots, writing this review 4/18/20 Just replaced the laces! Still look and fit like new, wear every day! Buy these again? U Bet!
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Knap

customer_reviews.title: Nice light no break in What I expected Will keep ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice light no break in What I expected Will keep feet dry in dew grass but not waterproof
customer_reviews.author: Stanley doss

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of boots.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable boot. Take little time to break in. Lightweight and durable, feel more like a shoes than a boot. Provide great traction on the desert trails in AZ.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable, easy lacing
customer_reviews.text: Very light, very comfortable, easy lacing, like the looks as I wear lots of black pants
customer_reviews.author: Brian E. Fingerson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and very light weight
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and very light weight. If you follow Danner's guidance on how to fit these boots they are the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and very comfortable. I love Danner products and they definitely meet my expectations!!
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. 14ee fit great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. 14ee fit great. Light weight and breathable. Hope they hold up with all I will be putting them through.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lightest and most comfortable boots I've ever owned. Fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Comfort right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Love these new danners, right out of the box comfortable. Light weight and breathable in warm weather.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but flawed
customer_reviews.text: These are indeed nice boots but as many other have noted they have a design flaw in that they hurt your ankles at the top side edges of the tongue. I have two pair of these a leather pair and this cloth pair and both do it,. Not lacingthem as tight as I normally like to do and not using the top lace position takes care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Good vibrations

customer_reviews.title: Wore them less than 2 days scuffed all the "leather ...
customer_reviews.text: Wore them less than 2 days scuffed all the "leather or Suede " off the toe and my feet were wet all day. I'm a Danner Guy but not these!!
customer_reviews.author: alan b.

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. Love them so much I bought another pair in brown suede. Lightweight, water proof, very very comfortable while walking, running or standing for 12+ hours! Extremely impressed with these boots for the price. I honestly have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: jerolyn young

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Boots took exactly one week to deliver. Very pleased with the quality, comfortability, and fit. They look even better in person than the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Toph williams

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Sent back immediately they were super stiff I thought they were going to wear a hole in my leg
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bombinski

product_meta.title: Danner Men's Mountain 600 Enduroweave 4.5"-M's Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Inspired by decades of legendary hiking boots, we partnered with Vibram to forge a new path in hiking footwear. The combination of the Vibram SPE midsole and Fuga outsole gives unparalleled grip on wet and dry surfaces while providing superior cushioning without the weight. Designed to withstand the summer climate and terrain of the Pacific Northwest, we utilized a carbon-washed textile upper and an air mesh liner for breathability in warm temperatures. The Mountain 600 defines a new category in hiking boots we call Performance Heritage - combining our classic styling with lightweight innovation.
feature_bullets: Vibram SPE midsole for maximum rebound, comfort and support
TPU heel frame to enhance support and stability
Cushioning, open-cell PU OrthoLite foot bed
Vibram Fuga outsole with Mega grip technology offers superior grip on wet and dry surfaces
